attributes.action: Training on Mental Health for Ambulance service
attributes.background: It appears the Ambulance staff do not get the relevant training in Mental Health and they are faced with Mental Health patients on a daily basis. This is becoming more common but frontline staff do not have the skills to deal with risky, suicidal patients, why are they not having the training?
attributes.additional_details: As Mental Health is becoming more common as physical health it is agreed by frontline staff and Mental Health staff that they should have adequate training in Mental Health.

attributes.action: Provide the needed equipment to stop the collapse of the Mosul Dam.
attributes.background: The Mosul Dam is near collapse, with upcoming flooding threatening to cause the dam to break. If it did break, it's estimated that the ensuing flood could kill over 1,000,000 people, and displace millions more, causing a horrific level of death, and further increasing the scale of the Migrant Crisis
attributes.additional_details:
The Mosul Dam was built out of a material requiring continuous grouting in order to retain its structural integrity. In the aftermath of ISIS's capturing of the Dam, the grouting equipment was lost, and they don't have enough manpower to both fight ISIS and protect the dam. The Government should spend a section of its foreign aid/defence budget on providing this equipment, and in some manner freeing up the Peshmerga or the local population to regrout the the dam.

http://bit.ly/1RSTTb1

attributes.action: Release Government knowledge of extraterrestrials
attributes.background: The amount of sightings and people coming forward about interaction with beings of the years must mean the government be aware of it and keep information.  The release of of so called secret files by the MOD  was low level rubbish.  It's time for the truth. We have been lied too long enough.

attributes.action: An accused should have the right to total anonymity until a verdict is passed.
attributes.background: The legal assumption that a person is innocent until proven guilty is being degraded by a scandal thirsty media, aided by modern communication technology. An accused should therefore be protected through a legal right to total anonymity until a verdict is passed, in order to receive a fair trial.

attributes.action: Educate 11-18 s in self-defence, financial management and emotional literacy.
attributes.background: Many students leave school unaware of how to manage everyday finances. Students need to be taught how to express their feelings.  The growth in eating disorders among young men shows this to be a priority.Introducing self-defence education will help protect young people from social dangers.

attributes.action: Provide funding, equipment, training & materials to repair to Iraq's Mosul Dam
attributes.background:
Mosul dam is in danger of catastrophic collapse potentially killing over 1,000,000 people. Continuous repairs have been severely curtailed due to past conflict. A contract for a specialist contractor to repair the foundations remains unsigned as of 29/02/16.

Inaction will result in loss of life.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosul_Dam

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/mar/02/mosul-dam-engineers-warn-it-could-fail-at-any-time-killing-1m-people

attributes.action: Apply a "one out one in" system to any new appointments to the House of Lords.
attributes.background: There are already 816 unelected Lords and we don't need any more.  Whilst he has been arguing in favour of austerity David Cameron has  created 244 new Lords (56 since May 2015) who can claim up to £300 per day. In 2014-15 the Lords members' allowance and expenses totalled over £20 million.
attributes.additional_details: There is a very strong argument for totally reforming our Parliamentary system not just the old fashioned system of patronage but ,whilst it remains, it should at least not become even more undemocratic and expensive. David Cameron has already created Lords at a faster rate than any other Prime Minister since 1958. At the same time the Tories want to cut the number of elected MPs from 650 to 600. We are already the only country where the upper chamber is larger than the lower house.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for medicinal cures that work to be kept from being used
attributes.background: There are cures for several types of cancers and various other diseases, but because the medicine companies gain more money from treatment they are a happy to let people die.
attributes.additional_details: There have been trials for cures of leukemia 99 out of 100 people were cured but because pharmaceutical companies would lose money by giving out cures rather than traditional treatment they haven't released the cure and they won't!!

attributes.action: To revoke British Citizenship and passport if you commit a crime
attributes.background: To make a law that any person given British Citizenship and passport who commits a criminal offence and are jailed then the British Citizenship and passport are revoked and they are deported to their country of origin.

attributes.action: Provide better support, funding and awareness for epilepsy patients and families
attributes.background: This is something close to my heart. We sadly lost hayley aged 20 in 2015 to sudep, sudden death caused by an epileptic seizure. Please sign this petition to help raise awareness and funding for this horrible illness. Im seeing more and more tragic losses due to the illness, young lives being lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Sudep action
Epilepsy Scotland

attributes.action: Implement a fine system for disrespectful MPs during Prime Minister's Questions.
attributes.background:
PMQs is an opportunity for MPs to debate the matters that affect us. Currently it is a circus of crude, jeering, infantile behaviour.

No workplace should permit this sort of behaviour & as our representatives, MPs should conform to a higher standard, engaging in the debate, not petty squabbling!

attributes.action: Allow 15-17 year olds who take an interest in the EU Referendum to vote.
attributes.background: 15-17 year olds are a group that are not listened to enough. This needs to change, as the outcome of the referendum is something that will affect the future generation. If a 15-17 year old can prove that they take a genuine interest in the referendum, then they should be allowed to have their say.

attributes.action: support the make a difference and stop the violence campaign
attributes.background: there is a campaign for better treatment for victims of domestic abuse sexual abuse and rape we have 6 demands we want the government to meet to make life better for all the victims
attributes.additional_details: 1 put a independent unit with councils so they can directly fund charities who care and support victims 2 more resources and training for survivors who want to go on to help others 3 make it part of the national curriculum to educate children about abuse and learn about the morals and values around sex 4 get legal aid back for victims going through family court 5 more safety around access to children 6 tougher punishment for abusers

attributes.action: I want the government to STOP the privatization of the UK.
attributes.background: As 4 year "custodians" of the UK they have no right to sell what is not theirs to sell, their job is to govern the UK for 4 years, if the governments only solution to fixing the UK is to sell it to the highest bidder, they are not fit for purpose, a window cleaner dosnt sell his ladders!
attributes.additional_details:
Too many conflicts of interest surround MPs and their interest to privatize the NHS, The Royal Mail was sold at less than its worth, almost our entire infrastructure has been sold off like some crack addict looking for their next HIT, the list spanning 40 years is shameful and it must stop and stop NOW, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_privatizations#United_Kingdom
Please support this petition and fight to hold onto whats left of OUR infrastructure paid for from OUR taxes, Thank you.

attributes.action: Make MP's have to sit seven days a week as they are providing a public service.
attributes.background: Due to the fact that MP's are supposed to be providing a public service and also, the fact the country does not stop needing to be run during a weekend, Parliament should have to sit for 7 days a week with all MP's required to attend from 7am to 10pm.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the fact the country does not stop needing to be run during a weekend parliament should have to sit 7 days a week. All MP's should have to be in attendance each day and be available from 7am to 10pm for drop in surgeries for members of the public as most people work during normal office hours. As MP's are paid large salaries, they should be more accessible to the public and as Junior Doctors are now being expected to work longer hours MP's should have to do the same.

attributes.action: Make politicians pay an extra 7.5% tax on all expenses & rent paid by taxpayers
attributes.background: The government is constantly telling taxpayers that we need to reduce the deficit. Taxes are increasing for businesses (dividend tax is increasing by 7.5% in April, this will effect 5.4 million businesses). We think politicians should contribute more to reducing the deficit in the same way.

attributes.action: Give Us An Annual Poppy Day For All Animals To Be Remembered.
attributes.background:
Over the years there have been many pets that became War Animals who served and died for many different countries and yet there isn't a single DAY that commemorates ANY of them; War Animals Or Our Treasured Pets.  
Help us to gain momentum - and give the animals what they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
The idea for it came from author Jilly Cooper and some of her friends, a group of influential personalities in their own right, who in 1996 started the 'Animals in War' Memorial Fund with Anne, HRH The Princess Royal, as patron. Jilly herself donated to the fund all the royalties from her successful book Animals at War.  After a long and challenging nationwide fundraising operation the memorial was completed, it took 8 years.

Not many people are aware this monument exists.
Help us please.

attributes.action: Debate renationalisation of the UK railways.
attributes.background: According to YouGov Polls, 66% of the UK Electorate now support renationalisation of the UK railways. It is clear that privatisation of the railway system has caused massive operation inefficiencies due to the complexity of the railway network. This was the privatization too far.
attributes.additional_details: https://theconversation.com/how-did-britain-fall-out-of-love-with-privatisation-54094

attributes.action: Ask the Secretary of State not to give his consent for land to be disposed of
attributes.background: The land on pump hollow road /new lands road in forest town is currently used as allotments, the local council want to dispose of this land and we would like the secretary of state not to agree to the disposal of the land.
attributes.additional_details: The allotments currently have 27 people who have all worked them for many years and kept them maintained, building fences, supplying sheds, greenhouses, we wish to continue growing our own produce for our families and keeping poultry so we have free range eggs for our families.

attributes.action: UK Government to press the government of Iraq to grant Kurdistan's independence.
attributes.background: Kurdistan has been divided into 4 different countries, which are in Iraq, Turkey, Syria and iran. Kurds are a large ethnic group with a population of 35 million and without their own nation. We kurds deserve our own nation and independence , we have our own language, gov', culture, national flag.etc
attributes.additional_details:
-Kurds are currently defending their borders against ISIS with not so modern and limited weapons. 
-The kurds have regained all its territory back from ISIS. 
-ISIS struggle when in battle against the kurds

attributes.action: Environment Agency must clean up the abandoned Waste4Fuel site
attributes.background:
The Environment Agency failed to police the Waste4Fuel site, planning permission was granted to hold 5 tons of waste, the abandoned site holds 18 tons of waste. Cleanup has been promised to no avail. 
 
The site continues to a) catch fire & b) pollute the air.

attributes.action: Give UK citizens the right to bear arms.
attributes.background: There exists a law inborn in our hearts that if our lives are endangered by plots or violence or armed robbers or enemies, any and every method of protecting ourselves is morally right” ~Marcus T. Cicero
attributes.additional_details: The government of the United Kingdom openly admits it cannot protect it,s citizens from the new type of terrorist attacks that are taking place across the world , as per the Paris atrocity . It is  therefore unable to fulfil it,s responsibility in regards security of the people and should allow us to defend ourselves and our families.

attributes.action: Allow a vocational route mixed with some GCSE subjects not just the EBACC
attributes.background: At the moment there is the EBACC consultation that requires students to be studying this pathway from 2020  Whilst academic, this is narrow and does not encourage our "creators" and "doers" that may later on be our Electricians, Builders, Plumbers, Carpenters, Digital Media experts, Artists etc.
attributes.additional_details: Vocational Education Everyone says it's a good thing and it's vital for the economy. But - and there is always a but, it's still the academic pathway that has the higher status. We should have alternate pathways that allow all students to succeed in what they want to do. The solution would be more rigorous vocational subjects to be offered alongside or as  alternatives to GCSE's but still have equal weighting on progress 8.

attributes.action: Make all public houses in Nottinghamshire wheelchair accessible.
attributes.background:
I believe all public places should be accessible for all of our people. Places such as shopping centers, pubs, clubs, etc. 
All residents should feel invited and not excluded.

attributes.action: To have the [Lotto] Lottery run by the people for the people.
attributes.background: All monies from the lottery should be paid back to the people and not to a greedy corporate ,this is the peoples lottery of Great Britian which is currently owned by a Canadian company.
attributes.additional_details: People try and hope to have a better life by playing the lottery its disgraceful when less than 50% is given back in the prize fund some of money is given to good causes which are chosen by the lottery it should be the peoples decision,  the rest is given to corporate greed it is a disgrace,it needs to be reformed .

attributes.action: Petition Government to make theNational  Lottery wins smaller with more winners
attributes.background: ie 5 million per win  thus 10 players will each get this prize rather than one person getting 50 million . this huge amount of money could be shared out bringing financial happiness to more families.
attributes.additional_details: Lottery wins of the size of 5 million will help the average family to get a house each and have a sizeable income for the winner .

attributes.action: Put up a temporary footbridge in Tadcaster
attributes.background: After the collapse  of the Bridge in Tadcaster, many local residents are being highly affected by the closure of the broken bridge.
attributes.additional_details: A shuttle bus has been put in place for local transport links but doesn't drop off or pick up in convenient locations for anybody trying to get from one side of Tadcaster to the other. The only other option is to drive a 10 mile trip halfway to York and back to get to the other side. Businesses, students and commuters are all being affected.

attributes.action: Stop fracking exploration in Teesside, revoke licenses granted to Third Energy
attributes.background: Third Energy has recently been granted permission to explore for shale gas in and around the Teesside area. The areas they have been granted are heavily populated and also nature reserves and fracking would destroy these areas of beauty.

attributes.action: Make feeding owned cats a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Sign this petition to help get the law changed on feeding owned cats. 
Feeding someone else's cat can cause them to leave home, causing stress and upset to the beloved cats owners/family. 
At present the police/rspca/cats protection will not help, as there is no law on feeding another persons cat.

attributes.action: Extend paid maternity leave for mums who have premature babies in hospital.
attributes.background: After having a premature baby at 26+1 gestation and having spent 13 weeks in hospital. That's a third of my maternity leave used without having my baby home. Many other mums have the same problem not being able to take the unpaid leave due to not being able to afford it.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that if you have a baby more than 10 weeks early that has a long hospital stay, you should be able to apply for extended maternity pay and not start your official maternity leave till your baby is home so that you get the same privilege as a mum who has a full term baby with 9months paid at home with your child.

attributes.action: Ban petitions relating to election results as it insults democracy
attributes.background: There has been a glut of petitions which call for another vote when things don't go their way.  This insults our voters, makes a mockery of the democratic process and wastes time as its debated.  It also undermines other petitions which may have real value and real merit.

attributes.action: Create a multi-party team to negotiate the exit from the EU including MYPs
attributes.background: The exit from the EU has a long term impact. MYPs (youth parliamentarians) should be included in a new multi party team that leads the exit rather than the leader of the largest party in Westminster. This team needs to reflect the views and background of the nation as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: There are 12 different political parties with MPs in Westminster. There are 369 MYPs. The young have the most to lose from a poorly negotiated exit. Let's ensure a democratically representative task force, including all parties and elected young people leads the exit process. This will avoid the exit being led by a team with an unrepresentative perspective on what we in the UK want. This gives us a chance at getting the democracy in the UK that we deserve.

attributes.action: Ensure participation in EU free trade, science, security, & environment programs
attributes.background: Now we have voted to leave the EU we must ensure that we will keep access to as many of the EU structures and programs that have been so beneficial to the UK over the years. We ask the government to negotiate access to these programs including free trade, science, security, & environment programs

attributes.action: European Union Referendum, 75% Required
attributes.background: Call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the Remain or Leave vote is less than 75% then the Referendum Vote to Remain or to Leave the European Union is conducted again, until we reach 3/4 of the United Kingdom agreeing to either Remain or to Leave the European Union.

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship to all migrants living in the UK on the 23rd June 2016.
attributes.background: Let's start the UK's move to full sovereignity with a promise to migrants, both EU and otherwise,  that they will be entitled to full citizenship if they were registered as living in the UK on the 23rd of June 2016.

attributes.action: Make PM & Cabinet legally and personally liable for election promises.
attributes.background: As shown in the recent referendum, it has become too easy for campaign promises to be ditched and forgotten. That implies that victors are elected on platforms that they are not willing to or that are impossible to achieve. PM/Cabinet must therefore be held to account both as institution and person.

attributes.action: make no cuts to Access To Work at the DWP.
attributes.background: Access to work is the only way to  help employers to employ  disabled people.  It must not be cut.
attributes.additional_details: My name is David wilkins and I am a totally blind and partially deaf Freelance Journalist.

attributes.action: In future votes ballot slip to carry a warning that once cast the vote is final
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote and stories in the press that people voted out/remain as a protest and now wish to change their vote ballot slips should carry a warning that once placed in the ballot box your vote is final and can not be changed
attributes.additional_details: Also people should be made aware that in a democratic voting process when one side should win more votes than the other no matter how slim the margin the side with the most votes wins and there is no option to rerun the vote

attributes.action: Let Bristol & London remain in the EU following a majority in the referendum
attributes.background: Following on from the EU referendum, Bristol & London both had an overwhelming majority vote to remain with Bristol at 62% & London at 73.5%. They should therefore be allowed to remain in the EU governed as separate county states by local government.

attributes.action: Reform our parliamentary system in the wake of the UK's vote for independence.
attributes.background: One argument put forward by the Leave campaign was that the EU was undemocratic. This message undoubtedly struck a chord with many voters who feel disenfranchised. Yet Brexit will not solve this since our parliamentary system remains inherently unrepresentative for the following reasons:
attributes.additional_details:
- The House of Lords is unelected.
- First Past the Post is unrepresentative. UKIP (3881129) and Greens (1157613) needed vastly more voters per MP than Labour (40290) or Conservatives (34245) (https://www.opendemocracy.net/ourkingdom/liam-anderson/voters-per-mp-why-first-past-post-failed).

The following should happen before the next election:
- The House of Lords be replaced with an elected Second Chamber.
- A debate (and possible referendum) over the best voting system (PR, STV, AV+, FPTP).

attributes.action: Explore further concessions to remain within the EU
attributes.background: We propose that the government explore all possibilities of gaining further concessions from the EU in order that the UK might remain a member nation. The ramifications of leaving the EU will be devastating for the continent as a whole. All options need to be explored prior to closing the door.
attributes.additional_details:
It is evident that the UK's current relationship with the EU was rejected by a very slim margin and it is important that this rejection is respected. However due to the size of the margin and a previous offer of further concessions from it would be undemocratic not to explore all available options as long as there is sufficient support for this petition. 

We owe it to future generations to explore all options before we inflict such a profound socioeconomic change on the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: Create an independent City State of London & the surrounding areas.
attributes.background: Due to the recent European Referendum result, it's apparent that London has a significantly different outlook in regards to the rest of the world. We therefore wish for London to break away from the UK and become an independent, sovereign nation.

attributes.action: Adjust the status of UK residents on Tier2 ICT visa or cancel it from visa types
attributes.background: The Tier2 ICT visa is a new modern slavery, this visa status takes away all your privileges as a human. You pay equal tax as a UK resident yet because people knows that you can't stay for longer than 5 years there are many things you cant do, in my case: adopt, get a mortgage, change jobs and more
attributes.additional_details: UK government have changed the laws so that everyone who's living in UK for more than 183 days becomes a resident and pay tax, however, people in Tier2 ICT visa status do not get any benefits to the contrary, if they can't find a job outside UK within 5 years they end up paying an equal tax to a resident, stuck in a job they don't want to do (many employers abuse there ICT people because they know they own them), no bank will give you a mortgage because they can't trust what will happen to you in 5 years.

attributes.action: Replace subsidies for green energy (FITs)  with a loan guarantee scheme.
attributes.background:
Producing green energy has become more viable as cost of deployment has reduced drastically (IRENA).
Loan guarantees would enable more schemes to be built than subsidies (FITs) and could potentially negate the need for the nuclear plant at Hinkley whilst contributing towards environmental targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Government subsidies (FITs) for medium/large scale green energy schemes have been reduced.  
New schemes face difficulty in raising finance because lenders are unable to analyse the risk/reward the sector represents.  
Finance contributes to the 25 Giga Watts held up and awaiting deployment (DECC April 2016).  
A rolling scheme of up to £5 billion could replace the need for Hinkley Point C to be built providing 3200+ MW of green energy.
Example:  www.greensaturn.com/content/pages/renewablesnothinkley

attributes.action: Lobby FIFA to remove World Cup 2018 from current hosts Russia
attributes.background: A recent history of racist and homophobic chants and threats at Russian stadia, plus the well planned and brutal attacks on England fans at Euro 2016 strongly suggests Russia is a very poor choice to host World Cup 2018. The UK Government alongside the English FA should pressure FIFA to move it.
attributes.additional_details: Russian 'fans' have organised attacks during Euro 2016 resulting in serious injuries http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36515213. A Russian MP has backed the attacks, "I see nothing wrong with football fans fighting. On the contrary, well done to our boys! Keep up the good work!" https://twitter.com/Russian1972/status/742256350424641536). FARE has documented incidents of racists & homophobic nature in Russian football http://www.farenet.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/SOVA-monitoring-report.pdf

attributes.action: An electronic voting system needs bringing in.
attributes.background: By moving forward from the outdated paper-based voting system you will squash a lot of the rumours of a rigged election as many people do not trust the governing body. I know many people who do not vote because they believe that their votes are essentially changed due to having to use a pencil.
attributes.additional_details: Not only would an updated voting system be a step in the right direction but also it wood make our country look better and more fair. People may also be able to trust an electronic voting system more than the current paper-based one.

attributes.action: Sporting events involving national team/competitor
attributes.background: It is absolutely disgraceful that I as a British national should have to pay to watch my national team compete in a sporting event. All sporting events involving any national team or competitor must by law be screened on terestrial television.

attributes.action: Provide access to NHS prescriptions for adults diagnosed privately with  ADHD
attributes.background: Adult  ADHD  treatments and knowledge in the NHS is poor. Adults are  descriminated against, even though they make it cheaper for the NHS. The NHS will not prescribed ADHD medication via a shared care agreement between an NHS GP and a private psychiatrist.
attributes.additional_details: Diagnosis and treatment of adult ADHD is not as effective. The NHS is unable to provide adequate resources to manage ADHD.If the NHS had effective methods of diagnosing adult ADHD, and the specialists required then many would have their medications prescribed by the NHS, however this is not he case. Many are forced to go private and when a shared care agreement is requested they decline it. The guidance (GMC, NICE and BMA) does not state that the private consultant had to be NHS, just qualified.

attributes.action: Ban plastic ring holders or mark on the product ‘Cut Rings Before Recycling'
attributes.background: Paleopathologist

attributes.action: Make the exclusion from any society/club based on gender, age or race illegal
attributes.background: In light of the recent decision by Muirfield to exclude female members for joining the club as members clearly a change is required. We no longer live in a society where the exclusion of any individual based on gender, age or race is deemed acceptable. Discrimination should be a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: It should be illegal to exclude any person from joining any society or club based on gender, age, race, or any other form of discrimination. It is unacceptable behavior to do so and whilst it may go against 'traditions' or 'long held beliefs' for certain organisations, it does not match the positive attitude towards diversity that we should be supporting in this country.
